> How would i write the test code to make sure the order of put and get

You can work with Thread.sleep() in appropriate places, but this will make
your tests very brittle. 

A more secure option is to use "real" synchronization. I have a couple of
examples in chapter 10 of my book "Unit Testing in Java" which use utility
methods like checkpoint("<name of checkpoint>") and waitForCheckpoint("<name of
checkpoint>") to synchronize multithreaded test code and application code.

Johannes
